Reviews.Title: Works well better than expected
Reviews.Author: Ihaab Mohamed
Reviews.Content: purchased this after a lot of research. tested it for three days now. machine is very nice and light. keys have a nice crisp feel to the punch with no flexing. touch screen works well (need to get used to some of the changes as i am transitioning from Win 7) would have wished a back lit keyboard, but then again I knew this one did not have it.Battery life seems good. i have been using it on batter now for 2 hours. used internet, Corel draw, virtual DJ and still have about 2 hours battery life left.Laptops powers up in less than a minute. maybe this will change later but it is pretty good.Laptop is nice and light but still feels strong to the hand. hinge feels firm with a little snap when u close it.another important part for a portable laptop is also to have a small power brick. i have not seen any review that touched on this, so to help others here it is. This laptop's power brick is just 1.5 X 3.5 X 1 inch and weighs less than 150g (5.2 Oz)Cant find any negativesAs for Windows 8.1 i wish the program menu was as in Win 7 as i have to now go into search type and then find my programs. if there is a shorter way i still have not found it.About me: this is my forth laptop. had 2 Lenovos and this is my second Acer. I tend to research a lot before buying and in general use a machine more than 4 years. i also advise my friends on bests options to buy for their own needs. i also am comfortable removing the machine and doing upgrades myself.

Reviews.Title: PC works great... but touchpad is too large and gets in the way
Reviews.Author: Brooke Bickelhaupt
Reviews.Content: This PC is performing as expected.  Its fast and functional.  And contrary to popular opinion, I don't find Windows 8 to be awful (there's definitely a learning curve associated with it).My only complaint thus far is that the touchpad is entirely too large.  As such, the "pad" of my left hand is routinely resting on the touchpad, which really screws things up when I'm trying to use the touchpad with my right hand or if I'm trying to utilize the touchscreen.

Reviews.Title: Work horse for good price.
Reviews.Author: Mr Philip Y Wu
Reviews.Content: Good I5 in its class.  Together with good price, hard to beat.  No built in DVD, not gaming video.  Good touch response.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop value
Reviews.Author: Buck Guest
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop for my wife at Christmas as an "adult only" laptop. I was going to purchase a Dell but this Acer was the same price, had the same technical specifications, and has the touch screen functionality she wanted so much. She really enjoys it. It was a great value and has been reliable.

Reviews.Title: Good quality laptop for the price.
Reviews.Author: Faith Gaertner
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for a Christmas present. I was looking for a multi-touch laptop that could be used for light gaming, mild graphics work and hours of multi-media entertainment. The battery life is good for 15.6 inch screened laptop lasting past 4 hours for web surfing. I did not realize this unit did not come with an optical drive which is unusual for a laptop this size and there is a cover plate where one would be located. Fortunately I had a compact external DVD writer which worked perfectly for loading additional software. Overall, I am completely satisfied with my purchase would recommend this unit as a mid-level device.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price. Still looking for stuff to share but it is worth it I guess.
Reviews.Author: Julius
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a backlit keyboard and an optical drive but could not find any deal under 550 with those specs (plus at least the i5) so I settled with this. Great specs.The touchpad and buttons are a pain to use. I am about to contact acer if I have a dysfunctional one (hope not) but all is good.Touchscreen is good but I needed to buy a screen protector just so I don't regret. I got the 3 year canopy, I do not know if it is legit but...Keyboard, surprisingly is good. I thought I would be getting the nasty one.Battery life has been okay so far.Some hiccups here and there - I do not know if it is the laptop or the OS. The OS seems to be slow launching apps I guess. The laptop probably bec it just woke up from a sleep (?) or I have too much going on but it's okay. I am able to do more with this than a 1 Ghz processor laptop I previously had.

Reviews.Title: Decent Price
Reviews.Author: Bill Jones
Reviews.Content: My overall experience so far has been pretty good, I like the design of the laptop, and the performance is pretty good for the price range. I gave this a 4 out of 5 and didn't drop the rating for most of my CONS because I can understand sometimes you have a good apple and a bad apple, this is a great deal and worked fairly well up until a week ago. I just got the time to do the review, if this is going to be for a student, business professional, or gaming enthusiast I would certainly recommend this laptop.Bluetooth worked with my S5, it's added some extra value for portability in my opinion. If I was to go back in time and rethink this purchase I would have still made the purchase.Pros:I like the keyboard as it's pretty responsive for my needs.Touch Screen - don't use it very much but it's nice to have just in caseSpecs - The i5 seems to get sluggish at times during multi-tasking (Netbeans, Notepad++, Visual Studio 2010) but it rebounds nicely when the turbo boost kicks in.Intel HD 4400 Graphics - I didn't buy this device to play games on, however it is very nice to play games on the go, I play Tera Online and various other games on Steam. This laptop performed over my expectations, I'm able to do the Nexus without much difference from my desktop PC which is an Alienware, mind you the graphics are not as superb but certainly playable which added more value to my purchase.Cons:Internet Connectivity - I don't know if this is an inherited issue but connection drops frequently and I am going to contact Acer about thisSound - The built in Realtek Sound Device is constantly being stuck on headphone input

Reviews.Title: Touchpad not working properly.
Reviews.Author: James Alexander
Reviews.Content: I understand that this is a touch screen laptop.  It seems as though they really want you utilize that more than the mouse.  Half of the time my left clicks do not respond, which in turns leads to me use the touch screen.  There is no CD-ROM drive as other mentioned, but that is more of my fault for not reading the specs fully.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Computer but No CD drive???
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Homan
Reviews.Content: Does this computer have a disc drive for CD's and DVD's?I love this computer!But I have tried and tried to find this and I probably am missing it or it just plain isn't there (which would be my luck).I would still get this computer tho because its so nice and light weight also its More durable then all of my past computers.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer.
Reviews.Author: Ken Provus
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop for several reasons and the Acer Aspire rated well and fit my needs. My old computer must have had a jealous streak because it died/crashed/blue screened when I set up the Aspire as my desktop model. I really love it so far: Except for Windows 8 which is a pain...Since I still needed a laptop I bought another Aspire.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Ron Schaefer
Reviews.Content: A great value.  We looked at a number of laptops for our son to start college with and this one had the most features in its price range.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant laptop on a Budget
Reviews.Author: Fabian
Reviews.Content: I looked at over 100 laptops in my budget, but i found the perfect one!It has a touchscreen, i5-4200U processor and 6gb of ram, it performs wonderfully, i can even game a little bit with the HD Graphics 4400.The design is very sober, and  the touchscreen is kind of a fingermagnet, but it isn't really a problem. Acer App's are also annoying.Windows 8 is really the big winner here. Windows 8 with a touchscreen is the way computing is meant to be. Incredibly comfortable and smooth.Highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Carlos Jose Bastardo
Reviews.Content: very good elagancia and aesthetic, comfortable and fast producer i5 processor for good performance goog good doog  good good good

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Isabella
Reviews.Content: This laptop it's a gift for my sister, this PC is performing as expected, its fast and functional. I was looking for a multi-touch laptop that could be used for light gaming, mild graphics work and hours of multi-media entertainment. The battery life is good for 15.6 inch screened laptop lasting past 4 hours for web surfing.  I am completely satisfied with my purchase, touchscreen is good but I needed to buy a screen protector just so I don't regret. Keyboard, surprisingly is good. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: Jorge Kabbaze "JKYEYE"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fast, slim, good screen, great space between each key of the keyboard, vga port, good battery life.Cons: Have not a CD unit, windows 8.1 sucks (my personal opinion), when you active CapsLock doesn't exist ANYTHING that represent CapsLock is on or off (this is really annoying when enter passwords specially).

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Christian De Freitas
Reviews.Content: Great laptop, but i decided i didnt need the touchscreen and got the same, without the touchscreen, saved me a little over 100 dollars  http://amzn.to/Qtamrm

Reviews.Title: overall good except the volume
Reviews.Author: Anish
Reviews.Content: I liked everything else except the volume. Its very low even if I keep it in 100%.I have a dell with the same configuration which has pretty high volume.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Dennis Kammerer
Reviews.Content: Although it was delivered outside the expected dates given with no real reason, I'm happy with the product.  I will say that the mousepad is a little more sensitive than I would like, but I haven't read that far on how to change that.

Reviews.Title: Touch Pad
Reviews.Author: Gencie Junio
Reviews.Content: The touch pad is sometimes lagging and not working. I wish there is a CD rom drive hu hu hu

Reviews.Title: Our son loves his new laptop!
Reviews.Author: DVHH
Reviews.Content: The only issue we ran into was in trying to find the start menu to shut down computer.  Took us a few tries but we figured it out.
